main event: Witnesses reported seeing multiple unidentified flying objects in Dayton, Ohio during late October 1959, including a red light and a yellowish or blue-white light.
interesting points: One witness claimed to see a red light disappear at the horizon while another reported a yellowish or blue-white light circling back over the SE horizon., The sightings occurred around the same time, suggesting a possible pattern in UFO activity., Witnesses described the objects' movements as rapid, with one light observed for 1/2 minute and another for 3 minutes., Comments from the investigation indicated that the objects could be balloons or aircraft, with some uncertainty about their origins., A sketch provided by one witness indicated a round object with a tail, suggesting a more detailed observation.
sighted object: one red light, one yellowish or blue-white light
witness description: Individuals included at least two observers, some of whom were involved with local emergency services.
